title: React UI Components
description: A collection of reusable React UI components
readmeFile:
# React UI Components

This repository contains a set of reusable UI components for React, designed to make it easy to build beautiful and functional user interfaces.

## Usage

To use these components in your React project, simply install the package from NPM:

```
npm install react-ui-components
```

Then, you can import the components into your project like so:

```
import { Button, TextInput } from 'react-ui-components'
```

## Components

- Button
- TextInput
- Checkbox
- RadioButton
- Dropdown
- Modal

## License

This project is licensed under the MIT License.

title: Python Machine Learning
description: A collection of Python scripts and notebooks for machine learning
readmeFile:
# Python Machine Learning

This repository contains a collection of Python scripts and Jupyter notebooks for machine learning, including examples of supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and deep learning.

## Usage

To run these scripts and notebooks, you'll need to have Python 3 installed, along with a number of additional libraries, including:

- NumPy
- pandas
- scikit-learn
- TensorFlow

You can install these libraries using the following command:

```
pip install numpy pandas scikit-learn tensorflow
```

Then, you can run the scripts and notebooks from the command line or within a Jupyter environment.

## Examples

- Linear Regression
- Logistic Regression
- K-Means Clustering
- Convolutional Neural Network

## License

This project is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0.

title: Vue.js Starter Kit
description: A starter kit for building web applications with Vue.js
readmeFile:
# Vue.js Starter Kit

This repository contains a starter kit for building web applications with Vue.js, including a basic project structure, build scripts, and a set of commonly used plugins.

## Usage

To use this starter kit, simply clone the repository and install the dependencies:

```
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/vue-starter-kit.git
cd vue-starter-kit
npm install
```

Then, you can start the development server and view the example application:

```
npm run dev
```

## Features

- Vue.js
- Vue Router
- Vuex
- Axios
- Webpack
- Babel
- ESLint

## License

This project is licensed under the MIT License.
